physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient 2 was admitted with fever, tachypnea, and tachycardia. Patient 3, at three and a half months old, presented with respiratory distress, lethargy, and jaundice; examination revealed hepatomegaly.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient 3 was well until two and a half months when chronic diarrhea developed, deteriorating to respiratory distress and other severe complications by three and a half months.
